com.cgoab.offline.client.web
Class DefaultWebUploadClient

java.lang.Object
  com.cgoab.offline.client.AbstractUploadClient
      com.cgoab.offline.client.web.DefaultWebUploadClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
UploadClient
public class DefaultWebUploadClient
extends AbstractUploadClient

UploadClient that uses the traditional web (HTML over HTTP) interface to the crazyguyonabike server.

This implementation is inherintly fragile. It relies on the URLs and form fields used to add pages and photos not changing. This could potentially change. Such a change would have no impact on users using the site in a webbrowser as the site generates the forms that it expcets to be posted back at it, however this application would suffer. As an added guard this implementaton, during initialize(int, CompletionCallback) , checks if the HTML forms to add pages and photos have changed. If so it throws AbstractFormBinder.InitializationWarningException if unused fields were removed or new fields added (probably OK) and throws AbstractFormBinder.InitializationErrorException if required fields are missing (definitly not OK).

The intention is that this class can be removed and a much simpler implementation can be used that relies on a simple and stable published set of HTTP operations designed for programatic use (ie, non HTML UI).

Mapping of Operations to HTTP/HTML

If not specified, form values default to those found in the initialization phase.
Operation Implementation
Login POST to "/login/index.html" with [username,password,command="login",button="Login","persistent="0"]
expected 200 (OK) (assume META redirect to "/my/") else error
GET from "/my/account/" to verify login
extract realname and username using CGOABHtmlUtils.getRealnameFromMyAccount(TagNode) and CGOABHtmlUtils.getUsernameFromMyAccount(TagNode)
GetDocuments GET from "/my/"
expect 200 (OK) else error
extract documents from html using CGOABHtmlUtils.extractDocuments(TagNode)
CreateNewPage POST to "/doc/edit/page/" with [toc_heading_size, toc_heading_bold, toc_heading_italic ,toc_level, visible, date, distance, title, headline, text, edit_comment, format, doc_id, submit="Upload Pic or File"]
expect 301 (redirect) else error
extract the new page_id from "Location" redirect header, match against page_id=(\\d+)
AddPhoto POST to "/doc/edit/page/pic/" with [upload_filename, caption, page_id]
expect 301 (redirect) else error

Error handling

When an error occurs on the server the error message (if any) is returned to the user embedded in the page. There is no consistent location for this error message, it varies on the actual error that occured. So isolating the error message is virtually impossible. Additionally, this client may detect an error condition but the server will not know it was an error (for example, the login page html will be returned if we try to perform an operation before logging in). As a result this implementation provides the entire html page returned from the server to the error handler via a DefaultWebUploadClient.ServerOperationException. This can then be presented to the user allowing them to find the error string.
